1.segment: OBJECTIVES : Early infant diagnosis ( EID ) of HIV infection increases antiretroviral therapy initiation ,

2.segment: which reduces pediatric HIV-related morbidity and mortality .

3.segment: This review aims to critically appraise the effects of interventions to increase uptake of early infant diagnosis .

4.segment: DESIGN : This is a systematic review and meta-analysis of interventions to increase the EID of HIV infection .

6.segment: CINAHL , and PsycINFO to identify eligible studies from inception of these databases to June 18 , 2020 .

7.segment: EID Uptake at 4 -- 8 weeks of age was primary outcome assessed by the review .

8.segment: We conducted meta-analysis , using data from reports of included studies .

9.segment: The measure of the effect of dichotomous data was odds ratios ( OR ) ,

12.segment: development , and evaluation ( GRADE ) approach was used to assess quality of evidence .

13.segment: SETTINGS : The review was not limited by time of publication or setting in which the studies conducted .

15.segment: RESULTS : Database search and review of reference lists yielded 923 unique titles ,

16.segment: out of which 16 studies involving 13,822 HIV exposed infants ( HEI ) were eligible for inclusion in the review .

17.segment: Included studies were published between 2014 and 2019 from Kenya ,

18.segment: Nigeria , Uganda , South Africa , Zambia , and India .

20.segment: nine ( experimental ) and seven ( observational ) studies included had low to moderate risk of bias .

21.segment: The studies evaluated eHealth services ( n = 6 ) ,

26.segment: Overall , there was no evidence that any of the evaluated interventions ,

28.segment: integration of EID , conditional cash transfer ,

29.segment: mother-to-mother support , or partner ( male ) involvement ,

30.segment: was effective in increasing uptake of EID at 4 -- 8 weeks of age .

31.segment: There was also no evidence that any intervention was effective in increasing HIV-infected infants ' identification at 4 -- 8 weeks of age .

32.segment: CONCLUSIONS : There is limited evidence to support the hypothesis that interventions implemented to increase uptake of EID were effective at 4 -- 8 weeks of life .

33.segment: Further research is required to identify effective interventions that increase early infant diagnosis of HIV at 4 -- 8 weeks of age .
